page.title: 09Farming
page.content: There are approximately 20 farms. The average size of each would be around 140 acres. The majority of the land is arable. The main crops grown are wheat, barley, potatoes, oil seed rape and sugar beet. Some farmers keep cattle, pigs and sheep. Nowadays farming has changed considerably due to machinery availability which is labour and time saving. Farms have most of the following machinery available; combine harvester, sprayer, baler, hay turner, cultivator, drill, fertilizer spreader, muck spreader, rollers, elevator, potato riddler, mower, potato and sugar beet harvester, and discs. Some of the farmers are tenants. A tenant is a farmer who does not own any of his land or farm yard. Approximately 60% of the land is owned and 40% is tenanted.
